label: Java
content:
## Java

My primary language and the core of my professional work.

**Proficiency**: Advanced
**Years**: 3+

Used in: Enterprise backend systems, Spring Boot microservices, high-traffic APIs

Java taught me the value of strong typing, design patterns, and building systems that last. From enterprise-scale services to complex data migrations, Java is where I do my best work.

> "Java isn't just a language — it's an ecosystem that teaches you how to build reliable software."

label: Spring Boot
content:
## Spring Boot

The framework that makes Java development productive and enjoyable.

**Proficiency**: Advanced
**Years**: 2+

Used in: RESTful APIs, microservices, enterprise applications, data processing

Spring Boot handles the boilerplate so I can focus on business logic. Dependency injection, auto-configuration, and the vast Spring ecosystem make it the right tool for enterprise-scale systems.

> "Spring Boot is opinionated where it matters and flexible where it counts."

label: PHP / Laravel
content:
## PHP & Laravel

The language that started my professional career. Three years of freelance work built on PHP.

**Proficiency**: Advanced
**Years**: 3+

Used in: Web applications, backend systems, Laravel projects, custom frameworks

PHP taught me the fundamentals of web development. From vanilla PHP to Laravel's elegant MVC, and eventually building my own framework (Apantos), PHP was the foundation of everything.

> "PHP gets a lot of criticism, but it taught me how the web actually works."

label: JavaScript
content:
## JavaScript & React.js

Frontend experience that makes me a better backend developer.

**Proficiency**: Intermediate
**Years**: 2+

Used in: React.js applications, frontend components, API integration

Working with JavaScript and React at LaunchingMax gave me perspective on how frontends consume APIs. Understanding both sides of the stack is invaluable.

> "Knowing JavaScript makes you understand what your API consumers actually need."

label: MySQL
content:
## MySQL

The relational database that powers most of my projects.

**Proficiency**: Advanced
**Years**: 4+

Used in: Web applications, enterprise systems, data-heavy projects

From basic CRUD to complex queries, indexing strategies, and performance optimization — MySQL is a tool I know deeply.

> "A good database schema is the foundation of a good application."

label: Redis
content:
## Redis

In-memory data structure store. Caching, sessions, and more.

**Proficiency**: Intermediate
**Years**: 2+

Used in: Caching layers, session management, data management at Neshan Maps

I learned Redis hands-on at Neshan Maps, using it for caching and data management in production systems that served millions of users.

> "Redis is the Swiss Army knife of backend performance optimization."

label: Docker
content:
## Docker & Containerization

The tool that standardized deployment. "It works on my machine" became "it works everywhere."

**Proficiency**: Intermediate
**Years**: 2+

Used in: Development environments, deployment, service isolation

Docker changed how I think about application deployment and environment consistency.

> "Docker isn't just a tool — it's a mindset of isolation and reproducibility."

label: Linux
content:
## Linux

The operating system that runs the internet. Essential for any backend developer.

**Proficiency**: Advanced
**Years**: 5+

Used in: Server environments, development, system administration

Linux is where I'm most comfortable. From shell scripting to server management, understanding Linux deeply is non-negotiable for backend work.

> "Linux isn't just an OS — it's a philosophy of openness and control."

label: REST API
content:
## RESTful API Design

The art of creating interfaces that systems and developers depend on.

**Proficiency**: Advanced
**Years**: 4+

Includes: REST, API versioning, error handling, documentation

Designing APIs for high-traffic systems at Navashgaran taught me that every endpoint is a contract. Consistency, clarity, and reliability matter above all.

> "A good API is like a good conversation — clear, predictable, and respectful of everyone's time."

label: Git
content:
## Git

Distributed version control that enables collaboration at scale.

**Proficiency**: Advanced
**Years**: 5+

From basic commits to branching strategies and code reviews — Git is fundamental infrastructure for any developer.

> "Git is a time machine for code. Understanding it deeply is a superpower."

label: RabbitMQ
content:
## RabbitMQ

Message broker for asynchronous communication between services.

**Proficiency**: Intermediate
**Years**: 1+

Used in: Service-to-service communication, event-driven patterns, task queues

RabbitMQ taught me the power of asynchronous processing and how to decouple systems for better reliability.

> "Not everything needs to happen right now. Some things are better when they happen reliably."

label: Hibernate
content:
## Hibernate

Object-Relational Mapping that bridges Java objects and database tables.

**Proficiency**: Intermediate
**Years**: 2+

Used in: Enterprise applications with Spring Boot, complex data models

Hibernate handles the mapping between the object world and the relational world. Understanding when to use it and when to drop to raw SQL is key.

> "The right abstraction saves time. The wrong abstraction costs more than no abstraction."
